channel.title: [Pi] Help With Portal TelePorts
channel.description: On A Pi Server, How can i add an option to a portal that i want it to have a message before it tele's you. As saying it would be danger, would you like to tele.. A yes and No clickable option. The Objectspawn of the portal would Be "6282"/

item.title: [Pi] Help With Portal TelePorts
item.dc:creator: @d_thaosta d_thaosta@hotmail.com
item.description:
@d_thaosta wrote:

**Fixed, Nvm i got everything to work fine now, Thanks Bro.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Help With Portal TelePorts
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

firstClickObject().

Within that have a new dialogue sent.

Link the options with cases 9157/9158 in the ClickingButtons class.

EG

case 6282:
c.getDH().sendOption("Yes", "No");
c.dialogueAction = 6282;
break;

Within case 9157 & 9158, respectively.

switch(c.dialogueAction) {
case 6282:
c.getPA().movePlayer(forgotParamsSorry);
c.sendMessage("You're teleported to ________");
break;
}
switch(c.dialogueAction) {
case 6282:
c.getDH().sendStatement("Return later....Adventurer!");
break;
}

Sorry about the shitty conventions and forgetting the params on movePlayer, it’s been a long time since I looked at PI.
c.

Read full topic
